context: How do u use this control

context: I have seen a device called the GBA Worm Light (Screen Light for Gameboy Advance) does that mean you need light on the screen to see the game?

context: Can you use external speakers (like through a stereo receiver) instead of headphones and still get the same surround effect?

context: Can you play the campaign with two players? Or is it just one..?

context: Is it backwards compatible?
response: Only the 60gb version(CECHA01) is truly backwards compatible with 98% of PS1 and PS2 games.  The 80gb(CECHK01) uses software emulation and has much less compatibility(80%+/-). No other models have backwards capabilities.

context: Are there more buttons on the right-hand side of the mouse or just the two on the left that are next to where the thumb rests?
response: There are a total of 7 programmable buttons: two on the left (where the thumb rests), two on the right (next to pinky), left click, right click, and the scroll wheel itself. There is a eigth button but this is used to switch between your pre-programmed DPI settings and not for use as a interface button.Steel Series Engine: http://steelseries.com/us/support/downloads

context: What do you mean by 'Brown Switches?'  Is the key light white and the keyboard black?   Thanks!
response: A "brown" switch refers to the style of mechanical switch used for the keys. The color of the lighting and keyboard aren't brown. This site here: http://www.keyboardco.com/blog/index.php/2012/12/an-introduction-to-cherry-mx-mechanical-switches/ offers a pretty decent guide to what different types of mechanical switches are and do. The key lighting is still white, and the keyboard itself is still black.

context: Will the software work on windows 7 ?
response: I owned the entire series when I was running XP.  When I upgraded to Windows 7, it would no longer work.  Went to the silly online game for AoE.  So did they rework the software so it now works on Windows 7?  Because the original software does not.

context: Does this controller come with the cord? I understand from the description it is used only with a wire, just asking if the cable is included.
response: Yes. It is permanently attached, in fact.

context: Is there any REAL problems with the mouse right now? because i heard of problems back in early 2013 about this mouse and I want to know if it's fixed.
response: Not one issue with the hardware or the software suffered to date. Been enjoying this mouse daily for months on end.

context: I have a Netbook without internal DVD player. Do you need to have the DVD on the system (external) to play it?
response: No....Once the game is installed on you're computer you can remove the disc and the game will still play.

context: Can you watch videos on this?
response: you can get on the internet and watch youtube videos on the 3ds. Not sure about streaming videos I haven't tried it.

context: Does it come with game codes or disks?
response: It depends on the bundle! I received a disk with Halo 3, and a code for Tomb Raider. Read the description carefully!

context: Do I have to use the activation code to get the mounts? I was hoping they were seperate codes.
response: Yes you need the activation code to get the mount. And dont forget to put in the code in reverse and get a second one. Happy gaming !!

context: Is this game appropriate for a 7 year old boy?
response: Yes, I'd say so. The game features typical "Mario & Luigi"-style cartoon mischief, involving jumping and hammer attacks on enemies. A seven-year-old might find the game a bit challenging, but I don't see any age-related content issues.

context: Are the end connectors 2.5 mm or 3.5 mm?  My son's X31 uses 2.5 mm and a white talkback cable.  Newer X31 models appear to be 3.5mm.
response: Its 2.5mm. The same size as the xbox controller jack for both ends

context: Does it work on a Mac?  Please no guess or opinions.  A feedback from someone that's using it on a mac would be appreciated.  Thanks
response: It does work if you download "Gamepad Companion" or "Joystick Mapper." They can map the keyboard controls to the controller buttons. You can also customize the each button. I've used both of these apps and both of them work perfectly.

context: does this game have local co-op or couch co-op? which ever means 2 players for you guys thats its not online...thanks
response: This game doesn't have couch co-op or local co-op. Co-op is only available on Xbox live

context: Can this charger be mounted vertically (ex: on a wall) and still work without the controllers falling?
response: I don't think that would be feasible.  I believe they would definitely fall out.  Gravity holds the controllers against the charger contacts and that would only work with it lying flat.

context: Is this keyboard wireless or wired?
response: yes it is, but i wouldnt hold that against it. it is an extreme upgrade, or at least it was for me. and the reach is pretty good, but i am sure you could go to the amazon purchase location and it will tell you how long.

context: Are there boss fights in this game?
response: Yes. There aré several boss fights that lead to a level ending.

context: Do you need 2.0 gb of free space on your Xbox to play it? But practically what are the requirements
response: No it is not a problem with free space, it is because of the region, this is an xbox version of the game for USA region not UK

context: how different is this from fallout 3? I never completed FO3 but enjoyed the atmosphere and the idea that it starts you as a child.
response: FONV is similar to FO3 in concept. FONV is different in that it dumps you right into the action with more creatures and gangs. As with FO3 it has several DLCs  too. The graphics are slightly improved. Of course the setting is pretty cool. Please do finish FO3, good fun.

context: Jeez, what EXACTLY does the red button on top do? Can IT be reprogrammed?
response: The red button can be programmed. It is like all the other buttons on the mouse, just red(maybe it is a common fire button spot)

context: can you play this on xbox one? or do you have to play it on xbox 360 only?
response: its a 360 only game. Don't think they will remake it for the xbox one

context: Just To be clear it can be used with a pc and how would I connect it to my pc?
response: The base has a USB cable, just plug one end into your PC and the other end into base of your headset.  You may have to install some turtle beach software also but it shouldn't be a big deal.

context: Hi, Does this product includes the CD-Key needed to register and play?
response: Yeah it includes everything you need. Just follow the instructions :) You'll download the game launcher then punch in your activation key and then that will download the game and you'll be good to go. Expect a long download about 12-14fb in total.

context: Can i redeem right away one the Xbox One?
response: If you mean as soon as you pay for it no. It will be sent to you in a plastic case with a download code for ghost xbox one and 360. It took at least 3 to 5 days to receive the codes.
